title: Charge sphere set -electric potential energy graph

content.description: Two small spheres have charges of equal magnitude <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and opposite signs. The spheres are initially at rest and separated by a very large distance, as shown in the initial configuration. The sphere on the right is then moved at constant speed to another position closer to the charge on the left, as shown in the final configuration. Assume the spheres are small compared to both the initial and final separations.
content.question: Which of the following graphs shows the electric potential energy <math alttext="U sub E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for the two spheres as a function of the distance <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between the two spheres?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with the horizontal axis labeled r and the vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins at the origin and curves slightly upward and to the right at an increasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled r and vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins near the bottom of the vertical axis, below the origin, and curves upwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point and just beneath the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with the horizontal axis labeled r and the vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins at the origin and curves steeply upwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and near the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with the horizontal axis labeled r and the vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins at the origin and curves gradually downward and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and at the bottom of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with the horizontal axis labeled r and the vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and curves downwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point and just above the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled r and vertical axis labeled U sub E. The line begins near the bottom of the vertical axis, below the origin, and curves upwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point and just beneath the horizontal axis.
